home.descricao: Undergraduate student in Computer Science at the Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG).
home.interesses: Strong interest in the fields of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Cybersecurity, with a focus on the automotive market and embedded computing.
home.interesses2: Also has a great interest in Data Science and Operations Research, which has been reflected in his accomplishments, including the development of an initial Machine Learning algorithm, and the implementation of the Simplex algorithm in Python.

trabalhos.ciberseguranca_desc: Researcher in the area of DevSecOps, focused on static (SAST) and dynamic (DAST) analysis of vulnerabilities in the systems of the Public Prosecutor's Office of Minas Gerais (MPMG) and the Integrated Security Office (GSI). In addition, with an article published in the Integrated Software and Hardware Seminar (SEMISH) 2025.
trabalhos.mineracao_desc: A project focused on discovering patterns in apartment rental data in the USA. Several data cleaning and analysis techniques were applied and discussed in the report available below.
trabalhos.analise_desc: Mapped the average prices of apartments in the U.S. and identified areas where high-priced apartments are concentrated.
trabalhos.agrupamento_desc: Several techniques (K-Means, DBSCAN...) were used to cluster the data based on available numerical attributes in the dataset.
trabalhos.regressao_desc: Enabled predictions from the data and yielded satisfactory results. Well-known techniques were applied, along with error and metric quality analysis.
trabalhos.itemsets_desc: We identified significant patterns among the amenities offered in apartments, revealing frequent and relevant associations between itemsets.
trabalhos.simplex_desc: Developed by George Dantzig in 1947, the Simplex algorithm is a powerful and efficient method for solving linear programming problems. This work was developed during the Operations Research course (DCC035), taught by Professor Cristiano Arbex Valle (PhD in Applied Mathematics). The project was implemented in Python and uses the extended LP model, providing optimality/infeasibility certificates. Thus, it can solve various LPs with great performance.
trabalhos.gps_desc: A GPS system was developed for the UFMG racing team’s car. This system used the following technologies: Arduino, C++, U-blox NEO-6M GPS, Google Colab, Python, Pandas, Folium, Plotly, and TinyGPS.
trabalhos.gps_desc2: The development was end-to-end, from assembling the components on Arduino to processing and analyzing the collected data. You can view the analyses and even test the code with other GPS data in the same U-blox format.
trabalhos.desenv_software_desc: Several works have been done in this area. Also works on the development of...
trabalhos.foodfit_desc: Diet generation system using Artificial Intelligence via ChatGPT API, built with JavaScript and React.
trabalhos.comanda_desc: Individual tab system for bars and customers, aimed at simplifying bill splitting, built with JavaScript, TypeScript, and Vue.
trabalhos.santiago_desc: Internal software for contract management and monitoring at Santiago Cotton LTDA, developed in C# using .NET framework with Windows Forms.
trabalhos.ia_desc: Works as a developer at Radio Memory, focusing on neural network development and supporting AI innovations aimed at radiology solutions.
